venue.name: Harvard Museum of Natural History, Geological Lecture Hall

item.description: Dr. David Page, Director of the Whitehead Institute and Professor of Biology at MIT, studies sex chromosomes and the critical role they play in human reproduction, with special focus on the evolution of the Y chromosome. His laboratory is currently seeking to unravel the genetic mechanisms responsible for a range of male sexual disorders, from failed sperm production to sex reversal to Turner Syndrome. Free and open to the public. Supported by a gift from Drs. Herman and Joan Suit.
item.name: Evolution Matters Lecture: Evolutionary & Genetic Basis of Human Reproduction
